title: Pentagon picked four tech companies to form $9B cloud computing network
description: Microsoft agrees multi-cloud strategy is "the right one" for defense department.

title: “Memory Saver” might cure Chrome’s insatiable appetite for RAM
description: Background tabs will get kicked out of memory, but only if you allow it.

title: DeepMind’s latest AI project solves programming challenges like a newb
description: Google's AI division tackles programming languages with a language model.

title: Twirling parasitic worms throw dance party in man’s scrotum
description: In medical terms, the dance party is called the "filarial dance sign."

title: Twitter sued for targeting women and staff on family leave in layoffs
description: Twitter laid off 63% of women in engineering roles compared to 48% of men.

title: Myth, busted: Apatosaurus didn’t produce sonic booms when whipping its tail
description: Former Microsoft CTO Nathan Myhrvold did first computer simulations in late 1990s.

title: FTC files suit to stop Microsoft’s $69 billion Activision purchase
description: Microsoft would gain "means and motive to harm competition," regulator says.

title: A quick look at AMD’s Radeon RX 7900 XTX, which is smaller than an RTX 4080
description: We can't talk about performance yet, but these GPUs should fit in most PC cases.

title: Google’s cost-cutters come for Waze, will lose status as independent company
description: Google says it "remains deeply committed" to the Waze app.

title: North Korean hackers once again exploit Internet Explorer’s leftover bits
description: There are still lots of ways to exploit Internet Explorer through a Word doc.

title: The clock is rapidly ticking on Apple’s Lightning charger
description: EU government says USB-C compliance is mandatory by December 28, 2024.

title: Twitter Blue will reportedly cost $11 in App Store so Musk can avoid Apple fees
description: Reports suggest Musk is looking to pass Apple fees on to Twitter users.

title: General Motors installs the first of 40,000 new EV chargers
description: Nearly 1,000 GM dealers have enrolled in the program to double level 2 chargers.

title: Win hardware, collectibles, and more in the 2022 Ars Technica Charity Drive
description: Help yourself to prizes by helping us raise money for good causes.

title: Amazon’s Echo Show 15 smart display becomes a portable Fire TV
description: Amazon already had a lot of success with Fire TV devices.
